text:
technical questions:
1. if i use HubSpot do i have access to raw server logs?
2. can i set up a htaccess file on HubSpot server for my domain? I would like to deny some traffic

Not sure if this is the right place to ask but I'm looking for a bit of help with setting up a webhook.
I have a booking system and I want to keep user details in it synced with Contact records in HubSpot.
So when a HubSpot Contact is updated (or specific properties are updated) I want a webhook to send the contact record to an endpoint on my end.
I've watched a video that explains about the 3 ways webhooks can exist and decided to go with the way that's available to the free tier - Not sure if this is the best for my use case.
So I have a developer account, created an App and added a webhook, with an event subscription that looks for a Contact object type to be created, or the specific properties changed.
I'm now looking for a way to link this app to my HubSpot account.
For this - I believe I need to create an oAuth flow. So I've got as far as receiving a code from HubSpot - but now i'm not sure what I need to do with this.
The docs say that for the app to appear in myHubSpot account I only need to get to step 2 - but the app isn't showing up

hi <@U02JU710E73>,

if you got the access code, app is installed and you should be able to recieve webhooks

Hi <@UCH1L597V> - thanks for getting back to me.

I receive a `code` at my redirect_uri but I'm not sure what the HubPpot endpoint is that I
need to post to that's going to give me an access token

Never mind I've sorted it.
I needed to exchange the code for an access token and found the docs here.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
glad that it worked for you!
Do you know if I can receive a contacts properties in a webhook when a contact is created?
using webhook api, you can have only the predefined fields, as mentioned here - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>

but if you do it workflow way, Once the webhook action is triggered, a JSON response body will be sent to the webhook containing all information about the contact, including form submissions, list memberships, and all contact property values.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>
But what Trigger would I put in place that watches all Contact properties?
Never mind - I can do it when the `Create date` property is known
Hmm that doesn't work afterall

Heyo friends!  We are having an <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/128197-Events/OCT-21-Open-for-Questions-Live-AMA-on-Sandbox-Software-w/td-p/509890|AMA with Collette King>, Product Manager of Sandboxes, in 20minutes.  If you have questions about sandboxes, you should check it out.

I want to get a field value from a blog post custom module to display on a blog listing. This should work right? {{ content.widgets.single_case_study_stats.body.section_title.value }} .value for a text field?
Is there a limit on the number of custom objects that can be created (custom object types, not number of records)? I think I saw 10 somewhere, but I can't find it again to verify it

If you click into developer info from the hs widget on a preview page it should give you the path that you’re looking for. 

Is it an actual module or just a field youre pulling from. Either way - the path above looks a little wonky to me. Difficult to say with certainty without knowing a bit more though.
I think this is what you are looking for. Second orange highlighted section (10) <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
Ah thanks. Yes, this is what I was looking for
Hi, how do I get my SubscriptionId for my newsletter so I can use it in the API? Seems like it isn’t exposed by the HubSpot UI… Thanks, Tom

So I have read that HubSpot serve next-gen format images for images in the file manager, like .webp, and I see this in the network calls but Google Search Console Page Insights are still flagging them as not next-gen format, why is that?

Not confident on the reason, but I’ve seen this before. I believe page speed insights is going off just the file extension.  Not actually analyzing the content of the file. As you said when you actually go to check the images they’re all proper webps when you actually look.

So it’s a false positive
